author: pipermerriam
content: Had some ideas on how we might use BEP29 + DiscV5 to do generic data streams for data that exceeds the UDP packet size.  Posted in <#682024484689149955> because it looks well suited to be a generic sub-protocol that could be used by multiple other sub-protocols.

author: pipermerriam
content: As in, handling for lost packets?

author: pipermerriam
content: Yes, there is an Ack mechanism that facilitates re-sending lost packets

author: pipermerriam
content: still griefable, but on par with TCP since it has that mechanism.

author: pipermerriam
content: I *think* that such a protocol *could* also be used for gossip.  worth exploring the idea since eliminating libp2p from the stack would be a nice simplification.

author: pipermerriam
content: Ok.  I've just opened https://github.com/ethereum/stateless-ethereum-specs/pull/54 which contains a really rough draft that I'll likely keep futzing with for the rest of today.  Feel free to leave comments on the diff.
